author: Mark Frary
title: Air France broke my guitar, but won’t pay
text:
John Peel called him “one of the most interesting and inventive guitarists around”. Michael Chapman, who emerged from the northern folk circuit in the 1960s, has travelled the world sharing his distinctive sound and is still on the road today. He recently flew with Air France from Memphis to Newcastle, via Atlanta and Paris. Travelling with him was one of his prize possessions, a vintage Martin guitar worth £4,000. The value of the guitar meant that Michael was keen to take it on board with him, but the airline said it was too big and asked him to put it in the hold.
During the journey, the guitar and case were damaged. Michael contacted the airline to ask for compensation; Air France rejected his claim.
